section.names: canales\ del\ tanque\ de\ sedimentación sedimentation\ tank\ channels title_canales_del_tanque_de_sedimentación
section.title: Sedimentation Tank Channels
section.paragraph: At one end of the sedimentation tanks there is a system of inlet and outlet channels (Fig. 33). A wall running along the channels divides them into two sections: the distribution channel (inlet) and the collection channel (outlet).

The effluent from the flocculator is distributed between the sedimentation tanks through the inlet channel. This is divided into two sections by a landfill: the first where the inlets to the sedimentation tanks are located, and the second which is only used to dump water in the event of a treatment failure.

section.names: primera\ sección\ canal\ de\ entrada first\ section\ entrance\ channel heading_primera_sección_canal_de_entrada
section.title: First section entrance channel
section.paragraph: The first section of the channel is designed to have a maximum velocity low enough to maintain an even flow distribution to the various sedimentation tanks. New tests at Cornell Labs show that floc breakage in the channel has no significant effect on sedimentation tank performance. Flocs, even if very small, with a velocity greater than the capture rate will be captured by the sedimentation plates. It is also designed with a high enough velocity that the flocs will not settle in the channel. Other restrictions on channel sizing are:

list_item.paragraph: It has to be wide enough for the tubes connecting it to the sedimentation tanks
It must be deep enough to support the outlet collecting pipes of the sedimentation tanks (there is only one slab for all the channels)
It can’t be so deep that construction and access become difficult

section.paragraph: Consideration of the uniformity of flow distribution between the sedimentation tanks is taken into account by setting the maximum head loss, \Delta H, in this channel to no more than ten percent of the total head loss through a tank. With this head loss, the width is calculated by:

line_block.line: Q = the flow rate of the plant = |Q.Plant|
H = the maximum water level in the inlet channel = |HW.SedInletChannelMax|
\Delta H = the maximum head loss on the input channel = |HL.SedInletChannelMax|
L = the length of the input channel = |L.SedChannel|
f = the coefficient of friction for a rectangular channel
R_k = the Reynolds number for a rectangular channel

section.paragraph: *The values of the fluid coefficients vary with the dimensions of the channel, so this width must be calculated iteratively by updating the coefficients until a constant value of this width is reached.

section.names: segunda\ sección\ canal\ de\ entrada second\ section\ input\ channel heading_segunda_sección_canal_de_entrada
section.title: Second section input channel
section.paragraph: The purpose of this second section is to dump water in the event of treatment failure, and to maintain the water level in the flocculator so that flocculation can be recovered without dirty water leaving the sedimentation tanks. The height of the landfill separating the two sections is just above the maximum water level in the first section at the design flow rate, so that it does not fill with dirty water during normal operation.

section.names: canal\ de\ salida output\ channel heading_canal_de_salida
section.title: Output channel
section.paragraph: The collecting pipes deliver the clean water to the first section of the outlet channel. This channel has another spillway that maintains the water level in the tanks. Since the water is not flowing along the first part of the channel, so there is no head loss, the only restriction with respect to width is that you need to be able to put in and take out the collection tube caps. On the other side of the chute, the width is based on:

list_item.paragraph: a minimum width for ease of construction
the diameter of the pipe that comes out to the filters

section.paragraph: All red PVC fittings are removable, including the nipples that cover the inlets of the chambers, the plugs on the outlets of the collecting pipes, the nipple that covers the drainage of the inlet channel, and the plugs of the surface cleaning pipes of the tanks.
